document.docAuthor: Sun, Yue, Yu, Lei & Li, Xinzheng
document.docTitle: Phylo heterochaetus Sun & Yu & Li 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species and a new species record of Orbiniidae Hartman, 1942 (Annelida, Polychaeta) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species and a new species record of Orbiniidae Hartman, 1942 (Annelida, Polychaeta) from China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: School of wetland, Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Coastal Wetland Bioresources and Environmental Protection, Jiangsu Key Laboratory for Bioresources of Saline Soils, Yancheng Teachers University, Yancheng 224051, China

figureCitation.captionText: Figure 1. Anterior end of Phylo heterochaetus sp. nov. Scale bar: 2 mm.

Figure 2. Phylo heterochaetus sp. nov. A anterior body in lateral view B parapodium of chaetiger 7 C parapodium of anterior abdominal chaetiger D parapodium of chaetiger 62 E diagram showing arrangement of anterior thoracic neurochaetae. Scale bars: 2 mm (A); 400 μm (B-D); 200 μm (E).

Figure 3. SEM pictures of Phylo heterochaetus sp. nov. A neurochaetae of thorax B uncini and subuluncini C modified spines D uncini of last rows of thoracic neuropodia E furcate chaeta F, G crenulate capillaries. Scale bars: 250 μm (C); 200 μm (A, E, F); 50 μm (B); 30 μm (G); 10 μm (D).

subSubSection.paragraph: All specimens incomplete, posterior end missing, holotype with 60 chaetigers, 34 mm long and 5 mm wide. Body elongate, about same width throughout; thorax depressed, abdomen cylindrical.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1. Anterior end of
Phylo heterochaetus
sp. nov. Scale bar: 2 mm.

Figure 2.
Phylo heterochaetus
sp. nov. A anterior body in lateral view B parapodium of chaetiger 7 C parapodium of anterior abdominal chaetiger D parapodium of chaetiger 62 E diagram showing arrangement of anterior thoracic neurochaetae. Scale bars: 2 mm ( A ); 400 μm ( B-D ); 200 μm ( E ).

Figure 3. SEM pictures of
Phylo heterochaetus
sp. nov. A neurochaetae of thorax B uncini and subuluncini C modified spines D uncini of last rows of thoracic neuropodia E furcate chaeta F, G crenulate capillaries. Scale bars: 250 μm ( C ); 200 μm ( A, E, F ); 50 μm ( B ); 30 μm ( G ); 10 μm ( D ).

subSubSection.paragraph: One paratype (MBM286986) with 13 and 14 anterior thoracic chaetigers on left and right side respectively, posterior thorax with 9 and 8 chaetigers, respectively. Holotype and other specimens with 13 anterior thoracic chaetigers, posterior thorax with 4-8.
The species is named for the thoracic neuropodia with two kinds of uncini.

This species is unusual in the genus in having anterior thoracic neuropodia with 5 or 6 rows of uncini intermixed with a few subuluncini in the first 1 or 2 rows.
Phylo heterochaetus
sp. nov. is similar with
P. ornatus
(Verrill, 1873) for: 1) anterior thoracic neuropodia with rows of uncini, 2) lacking interramal cirri, 3) anterior thorax with 13 or 14 chaetigers. They can be easily distinguished by 1) species of
P. heterochaetus
sp. nov. with 4-8 posterior thoracic chaetigers, while the latter species with 13 or more chaetigers; 2) species of
P. heterochaetus
sp. nov. with 10 or 11 subuluncini intermixed with first 2 rows uncini, while the latter species lacks subuluncini; 3) modified spines hastate in
P. heterochaetus
sp. nov. and acicular in
P. ornatus
.
